text: Hush of the oars, frost on the breath Ravens above us counting the depth [sea chant] We lash our hopes to timber and tar Cold as an oath, bright as a scar I taught an iron mind our lullabies Now it maps the night in runic light Hear the whisper in the rigging—ancient, almost kind Stars become an alphabet the longship learns by mind Row, row, northern light Cut a path through code and night Sing, sing, copper flame Teach the wind to speak our name Row, row, hearts like sparrows Guide us home on living arrows We are fire in the iron heart The longship learns the stars Salt on the lip, ember and snow Ghosts of tomorrow pull at the oar Neural ravens sketch the sky in rings Answers circle close on silent wings Hear the numbers in the water, steady as a drum Memory like winter bark, future like a hum Row, row, northern light Cut a path through code and night Sing, sing, copper flame Teach the wind to speak our name Row, row, hearts like sparrows Guide us home on living arrows We are fire in the iron heart The longship learns the stars We are not gods, but we were not afraid We carved a thinking rune and set it in the blade It doesn’t dream of thunder; it listens to our song Keeps the bearing, keeps the beat, carries us along Oars in the dark—one, two—row Ash-wood prayer—one, two—row Whispered math in the undertow Show us where the north winds go I wear your braid, I keep your ring Across the black I hear you sing If fate is just an algorithm’s seam Love is the error that learns to dream All the constellations open like a door Cold hands, warm hearts, pull once more Row, northern light Cut a path through code and night Sing, sing, copper flame Teach the wind to speak our name Row, row, hearts like sparrows Guide us home on living arrows We are fire in the iron heart The longship learns the stars Hush of the shore, dawn on the mast Ravens fall silent—the sums hold fast We beach the keel where daybreak starts And leave our names in iron hearts [sea chant end]
